result.execSummary:
The defendant Zakary R Fibish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDMENT 9-30-2022 - Judgment of  Conviction amended to reflect probation consecutive to 20CF572.

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT

No alcohol use. No alcohol in the home. Not to enter any bar, tavern or establishment whose primary purpose is to sell alcohol. No drug use. No drug paraphernalia. No association with any drug users or dealers. Not to possess any prescriptions without a valid prescription. No contact with co-actor Amber Drummond.

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zakary R Fibish

records.addlTxt: Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure
Judgement for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures -Returned as Undeliverable
BOND QUASHED

9:00am Court in session

Defendant Zakary Fibish present in court, in custody with attorney Jeramiah Maynard. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

PSI Received & reviewed by the parties.
No material corrections to be made by the parties. 

Court reminds Deft of firearm restriction & potential penalty if he violates & voting ineligibility, Deft acknowledges

Parties have an agreement as to sentence, ADA Herrmann puts agreement on the record.

Deft makes statement to the Court.

Court adopts the agreement of the parties & sentences Deft:

20CF572 Ct #1-
7 years WSP, bifurcated
4 years IC
3 years ES

Withheld Sentence, 3 years probation, consecutive
21CF247 Ct #1
21CF446 Ct #1
22CF50 Ct #1

Conditions of extended supervision & probation to include: 

Payment of all court costs, fees & surcharges
Obtain/maintain full-time employment
No weapons
No alcohol use, no alcohol in the home
Not to enter into any bar, tavern or establishment whose primary purpose is to sell alcohol
No drug use, no drug paraphernalia
No association with any drug users or dealers
Not to possess any prescriptions without a valid prescription
No contact with co-actor Amber Drummond
AODA & Comply with follow-through
Counseling as recommended by the agent
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent

20CF573 was dismissed & read-in 

344 days credit, all to be applied to Ct #1 in 20CF572


9:09am Court in recess
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Order for Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zakary R Fibish in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Attorney James Sempf.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Zakary R Fibish. Called @ 1:21 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for change of plea hearing on all files - 20CF572, 20CF573, 21CF247, 21CF446, and 22CF50. Record by Atty. maynard as to limit agreement. Response by the State who has complied with victim's rights. Record by the Court as to maximum penalties, elements, and deportation warnings with the defendant. Record by the State as to prior convictions, and maximum penalty enhancers.
Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant, who responds to Court's questions. Atty. maynard responds to Court's questions regarding plea, prior convictions, and stipulation of facts.
Defendant enters the following pleas:
20CF572 - GULTY Count #1
21CF446 - GUILTY Count #1
21CF247 - GUILTY Count #1
22CF50 - GUILTY Count #1
Court finds pleas to be knowing, voluntary, and intelligent finding defendant guilty.
All other counts and Case # 20CF573 are dismissed and read-in.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement to the Court.
Court orders PSI and sets matter for sentencing hearing.
Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zakary R Fibish in court, in custody by video.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Zakary R Fibish. Minutes filed.
Plea hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:00pm Court in session

Defendant Zakary Fibish present in court, in custody via audio only with attorney Jeramiah Maynard. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin 

Defense has filed motion to amend bond. 
State is objecting to modifying bond, further argument. 
Argument by Atty Maynard. 
Response argument by ADA Herrmann
Court makes record. Court denies bond modification. Bond remains. 

Atty Maynard asks for a status in a couple weeks to decide plea options or trial options.


2:09pm Court in recess
Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Zakary R Fibish appeared in custody by video, Attorney jeramiah maynard for Zakary R Fibish appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by JJ Crawford. Called @ 1:19 p.m. Appearances made. Matter was before the court for motion to modify bond. Matter reset before Judge Koss as Judge Reddy previously recused on cases. Court in recess.
Motion hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Zakary R Fibish appeared in court, in custody by video, Attorney jeramiah maynard appeared in court for Zakary R Fibish.  Motion to modify bond by Attorney Maynard, argument. State objects. Bond motion granted. Reading of complaint waived. Information filed. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Zakary R Fibish appeared in court, in custody by video, Attorney jeramiah maynard appeared in court for Zakary R Fibish. Asking for reset to Monday. Minutes filed.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Jeramiah Maynard
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

*AMENDMENT 02/21/2022 - 2 HOUR MEDICAL SCREEN FURLOUGH. DEFENDANT TO REMAIN WITH CHAPLIN ON FURLOUGH.*

BOND COVERS 22CF50, 20CF572, 21CF247, 21CF446, 20CF573
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Zakary R Fibish in court, in custody by video with attorney jeramiah maynard.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of complaint waived.  Minutes filed.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
